instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3662 - No post
threads.message:
MacBook starts, fan spin, no chime, no backlight, no light on optical mouse.
[LIST]
[*]No liquid damage,
[*]all voltages present,
[*]PPBUS_G3H = 12,58v
[*]VCORE = 3x 1,7v
[*]SYS_PWROK present,
[*]PM_S0_PGOOD present,
[*]No short between VCORE and PPBUS_G3H.
[/LIST] All suggestions (except dead CPU) are welcome :)

threads.title: 820-3662 - No post
threads.message: could be a dead bios chip. i would try a bios chip from a donor first before doing any ME stuff.

threads.title: 820-3662 - No post
threads.message: I agree with Alan try BIOS

threads.title: 820-3662 - No post
threads.message:
Sorry, forgot to mention this. Tried the following yesterday:
* Donor BIOS from 2013 board
* Reprogrammed the original with new 2014 bios.

Both produced no difference.

threads.title: 820-3662 - No post
threads.message:
How did happen?
Previous random shutdown, or other weird issue reported?

threads.title: 820-3662 - No post
threads.message: According to the customer, he closed the MacBook one night and it would not boot anymore the next day. No mention of previous problems.

threads.title: 820-3662 - No post
threads.message:
These boards are known for CPU power supply issue.
You get VCORE now, but CPU could get damaged by wrong job of one FDMF6808 in time.
You can try to change them with FDMF6708, but will not help in case of internal CPU damage...
